summary: FitGebit app for a Belgian dental practice: Internet Identity auth with roles (Assistants/Manager), assistant overtime tracking (assistants enter minutes only; manager oversight/export), plus a shared collaborative to-do list with audit logging, notifications, multilingual UI, and enhanced task operations (frequency selection retained but due-day selection removed and existing due dates wiped; main list hides frequency column; recurrence rolls to next Monday with monthly to first Monday of next month; urgency remains frequency-based; pinned priority, real-time updates, compact/mobile-friendly UI, and per-task completion evidence via comments + photos with a user-visible task history ledger).
architectural_notes: Use Internet Identity principals for authentication; store a per-principal unique username on first login.
Enforce role-based access: assistants can access only their own overtime entries; manager can access all assistants and audit logs.
Shared to-do list is global/shared state; audit log is immutable and manager-only.
To-do list becomes the default post-login landing page with navigation to overtime/manager views.
Support daily/weekly/monthly recurring tasks with computed next-due-date and urgency-based sorting; pinned tasks override sorting.
Implement real-time to-do updates via polling or websocket-like approach if feasible on the platform.
Task completion can include comment + photo; store high-quality images with compression/limits (not thumbnails-only); validate JPEG/PNG and enforce size limits.
Add a per-task immutable history ledger visible to all users; keep separate from manager-only global audit log.
Remove due-date/due-day from user-facing To-do UI; wipe existing stored due dates.
known_issues: Build/deploy pipeline failed with 'Our AI couldn't handle that request' when starting implementation; user requested rerun.
Draft preview shows a plain black screen after recent changes (app likely crashing on startup / dashboard render), user requested a fix.
Dark mode is not working across the whole app: toggling does nothing (observed in both Version 12 preview and the published live version).

existing_features.title: Keep the application name and branding as "FitGebit" across the UI (login, profile setup, header, and dashboards) and ensure all user-facing text is in English, while retaining language selection support for Dutch/French/English in user profiles.

Extend in-app notifications to include to-do list events: when a task is added, edited, or marked done, show notifications to logged-in users; ensure manager oversight notifications remain functional for overtime.

Add a new "To-Do" section accessible from both AssistantDashboard and ManagerDashboard (e.g., as a new tab) that shows the shared list of tasks in a responsive table, allows adding tasks, editing tasks, and marking tasks as done, and shows last completion (who/when) inline.
Add a manager-only UI view to browse the to-do audit log within the ManagerDashboard, including basic filtering (by action type and/or task) and chronological ordering.

Enforce role-based access and data-leak prevention for all new features: assistants must not gain access to manager-only views/APIs; to-do list must not expose assistants’ private overtime history beyond existing manager controls.

Add basic validation and error handling for to-do operations (frontend + backend): required title, valid frequency enum (weekly/monthly), and due date format validation when provided; surface errors to users via existing toast patterns.

Introduce a consistent, simple, responsive visual theme for the new To-Do and Audit Log screens that matches the existing FitGebit UI (cards, tables, tabs, and typography) and avoids introducing a new conflicting style direction.

Make the post-login default view focus on the shared To-Do list for both assistants and managers, while keeping clear navigation/tabs to access overtime tracking (assistants) and manager dashboard sections.

Remove any welcome screen/banner/large header sections that consume vertical space on dashboards, keeping at most minimal FitGebit branding, and ensure key content is visible without scrolling on standard screens (desktop and mobile).
Extend task frequency to support daily, weekly, and monthly in the backend API and frontend task create/edit dialog, including validation updates.

Implement recurring task behavior so that when a recurring task is marked done, the task automatically rolls forward to the next cycle (next day/week/month) and becomes "open" again for the new cycle, while still recording who/when completed the previous cycle.
Add manual priority (pinning) that managers and assistants can toggle on tasks; pinned tasks must remain at the top of the To-Do list regardless of automatic urgency sorting.

Automatically sort and display tasks by urgency (most urgent first) using due date proximity and recurrence, prioritizing overdue and soon-due tasks, while still showing the full list with no pagination/truncation.
Add frequency-based task color-coding using pastel colors (daily/weekly/monthly) that becomes more prominent as the next due date approaches; also show next due date on hover.
Add real-time-like updates for the To-Do list using polling (no WebSockets), keeping the UI clean and ensuring updates do not disrupt user interactions (e.g., while dialogs are open).

When marking a task as done, provide an optional comment field and optional photo upload; store photos securely with size limits and JPEG/PNG validation, preserving good quality with reasonable compression; show completion comment and thumbnail inline with completion details visible to all users.

Implement a per-task immutable history ledger visible to all users that shows a chronological log of all task actions (create/edit/mark done), including completion comments and photos; access this ledger by clicking a task (e.g., modal or expandable section). Keep the existing system-wide audit log manager-only.

Integrate new completion events (including comment/photo) with existing in-app notifications for to-do actions so users receive a notification when a task is marked done (and optionally includes whether evidence was attached), while keeping notification wording concise and in English.
Remove the due-day input from the task create/edit dialog while keeping the task frequency selector (daily/weekly/monthly). The dialog must no longer validate, parse, or submit any due-day value.
Remove the "Due Day" column from the main to-do table and stop displaying formatted due-day values anywhere in the to-do list UI.
Hide/remove the "Frequency" column from the main to-do table while keeping frequency-based task color-coding and urgency behavior unchanged from the user perspective.

Update all frontend date/urgency utilities so task recurrence and urgency are computed without any due-day input and follow the practice schedule: open days Monday–Thursday; closed Friday–Sunday. Daily tasks roll to the next workday (Mon–Thu). Weekly tasks roll to the next Monday. Monthly tasks roll to the first Monday of the next month. Urgency must be based on the selected frequency (daily/weekly/monthly).

Update the backend task APIs and corresponding frontend React Query hooks to match the new task shape (frequency retained; due-day removed). Ensure existing task create/edit flows still work end-to-end.

Change the assistant overtime entry UX to minutes-only input (single numeric field). Remove hours input from the assistant overtime form. The system must still present totals broken down into days/hours/minutes in summaries and exports by converting from stored total minutes.

Add manager-only tracking of assistant task preference/aversion per task (at minimum: Preferred, Hated, Neutral/Unset) so the manager can distribute work fairly. Assistants must not be able to view or modify these preference labels.

Update only the selected form field labels in the task completion dialog so the words "evidence" and "completion" are removed, specifically changing the comment field label to "Comment (optional)" and the photo upload label to "Photo (optional)" (English, exact casing).
Move the entire “Actions” column in the To-Do tasks table to be the leftmost column (header + all row cells), instead of being the rightmost column.
Remove the date input example/helper paragraph under the overtime date input (delete it with no replacement).

Fix the To-Do list rendering crash that causes a black screen by making the search/filter logic resilient to missing optional task fields (e.g., tasks with no description must not trigger runtime errors).
Harden the task create/edit dialog state initialization so it never assigns undefined/null into controlled form inputs (e.g., description must always be a string).
Add an application-level React error boundary that prevents a full black screen on unexpected runtime errors and shows a simple fallback UI with a reload action.

Add frontend React Query wiring for task deletion and integrate it into the existing to-do state management so a user can delete a task from within the task edit flow and the tasks list refreshes correctly.
Add a destructive "Delete" action to the task edit dialog (only when editing an existing task), and require a confirmation step before the task is deleted. All user-facing text must be in English.

Move the “Actions” column in the To-Do tasks table back to its original position on the far right (header + all row cells), while keeping existing click behavior (row click opens task history; action buttons and pin button must not trigger row click).

Add consistent overtime type color-coding everywhere overtime entries are displayed: “add overtime” uses a pastel red style and “use overtime” uses a pastel green style. Apply the styling only to the relevant value cells (not entire rows).

Extend the Manager Dashboard "Team" assistant detail view so that when a manager selects an assistant, the detail view shows (in addition to existing overtime totals/history/export/delete): (1) the assistant’s task completion history across all to-do tasks, (2) the assistant’s on-time completion frequency/rate, and (3) the assistant’s per-task preference/aversion indicators (Preferred / Hated / Neutral) in a read-only summary.

Add React Query hooks and frontend data wiring to fetch and display the new assistant task-habit data inside AssistantDetailView, with loading, empty, and error states consistent with existing patterns (Skeletons/toasts).

Compute "on-time" status for assistant task completions using the same recurrence schedule rules used by the app’s to-do urgency/next-due-date logic (workdays Mon–Thu; daily rolls to next workday; weekly rolls to next Monday; monthly rolls to first Monday of next month), and apply this consistently for the on-time frequency metric shown to the manager.

Ensure role-based access control and data-leak prevention for the new assistant task-habit manager view so that assistants cannot access the new backend APIs or see manager-only task preference labels for themselves or others.
Trigger a fresh rebuild and deployment of the latest FitGebit code (option 2), rather than publishing the already-deployed Draft Version 11 as-is.
Fix dark mode so it applies across the entire app and works in both preview and live versions by enabling system/device theme detection and ensuring the theme toggle actually changes the UI.
Set Dutch as the default language for new users during profile setup while still allowing users to manually change the language selection before creating their profile.

new_feature_requests.summary: Rename app to "FitGebit" with simple responsive UI header
Internet Identity authentication; first-login unique username setup; roles: Assistants and Manager (creator is Manager)
Assistant view: personal overtime add/deduct with totals shown as workdays (8h/day), hours, minutes; personal history only
Manager view: see all assistants totals and detailed entries; export overtime data to CSV
Shared to-do list visible to all users: add/edit tasks (title, frequency weekly/monthly, due date); mark done with who/when visible
Manager-only audit log for to-do actions (add/edit/done)
Notifications for new to-do actions
Basic validation, role-based access/security to prevent data leakage
Internationalization support: Dutch/French/English

Implement backend data model and APIs for a shared to-do list visible to all authenticated users (assistants and manager), supporting: create task, list tasks, update task fields (title, frequency weekly/monthly, due date), mark task as done (recording who and when), and returning last-completion details as part of task listing.

Add an immutable (append-only) audit log for all to-do actions (add/edit/mark done) in the backend, recording at minimum: action type, acting user principal, acting username, timestamp, task identifier, and a human-readable change summary; expose a manager-only API to query the audit log.
UI cleanup/compact layout: remove welcome banners/headers wasting space; keep minimal FitGebit branding; ensure key content visible without scrolling; mobile usability
Post-login default view focuses on shared To-Do list; provide tabs/navigation to personal overtime (assistant) or manager dashboard
Extend task frequency to daily/weekly/monthly; implement recurring behavior so tasks reset/roll forward after mark-done with next due date computed

To-do urgency ranking: auto-sort by urgency using last-done/created date, frequency, and due date proximity; overdue/soon-due prioritized; show next due date on hover; task color-coding by frequency with intensified color as due date approaches
Task list UX: load and show full list without pagination/truncation; allow scrolling for long lists
Real-time task list updates (polling or websockets if feasible) and integrate with existing notifications for to-do events including mark-done with comment/picture
Mark task as done with optional comment and optional photo upload (camera/device); display comment and photo thumbnail inline with completion details (who/when) visible to all users

Per-task history ledger visible to all users: immutable chronological log of task actions (add/edit/done) including completion comments/photos, accessible via clicking a task (modal/expand); keep separate from manager-only system-wide audit log

Secure image handling for task completions: allow high-quality images with reasonable compression and limits; validate formats (JPEG/PNG) and enforce size constraints; store originals (not thumbnails-only)
Manual priority/pinning: allow manager and workers to pin tasks as priority so they remain at the top regardless of automatic urgency sorting
To-do UI/data change: remove due-day selection and associated column; wipe all existing due dates
To-do main list: hide the 'frequency' column while keeping frequency selection in create/edit; keep task colors and urgency sorting behavior unchanged
Update recurring schedule logic for practice calendar: workdays Mon–Thu; weekly tasks roll to next Monday; monthly tasks roll to first Monday of next month; daily tasks roll to next workday (Mon–Thu)
Overtime entry UX: assistants enter overtime in minutes only; system computes totals into hours/days for summaries and exports
Manager workload balancing: track per-task assistant preference/aversion (preferred vs hated) and expose in manager view to help distribute tasks equally

Modify the backend to stop using/storing task due-day values, and ensure that any existing persisted due-day/due-date values are wiped during upgrade so all tasks have no due-day stored going forward.
Update task completion UI labels: use "Comment (optional)" and "Photo (optional)" and remove the words "evidence" and "completion" from those labels
Remove the date input example/helper text paragraph from the form UI (delete with no replacement)
Add ability to delete a task from the task edit dialog, with a confirmation prompt before deletion

Add a backend API to delete a to-do task by taskId, including recording the deletion in both the manager audit log and the per-task history ledger, and enforcing that only authenticated users can delete tasks.

Implement automatic cleanup of legacy/malformed to-do task data so old tasks no longer cause startup crashes, and ensure cleanup is applied in a way that does not require the user to manually edit each legacy task.
Move the Actions column in the To-Do tasks table back to its original position on the far right (header + all row cells).

Color-code overtime values everywhere: "add overtime" cells pastel red and "use overtime" cells pastel green; apply only to the relevant value cells (not entire rows) across history lists and summary/total views.

Manager dashboard: click an assistant name to open an assistant detail view showing overtime totals + full overtime history, plus task-habit metrics (task completion history, on-time completion frequency, and preferred/hated/neutral task indicators).

Add backend support for manager-only retrieval of an assistant’s task-habit metrics, including: a list of the assistant’s task completion events (across all tasks), aggregate counts needed to compute on-time completion rate, and the assistant’s task preference states per task.
Fix dark mode: currently toggle has no effect across the whole app; dark mode should follow device/system preference (works in both preview and live).
Set Dutch as the default language for new users while still allowing users to manually change language in their profile/settings.
